title: 110_hr6507
content: The "Invest in Small Business Act of 2008" is the short title of the Act. It includes increased exclusion and modifications for qualified small business stock. The "Invest in Small Business Act of 2008" includes increased exclusion for qualified small business stock held for more than 3 years. Stock held among members of a 25-percent controlled group is not eligible for this exclusion. The "Invest in Small Business Act of 2008" increases the exclusion for qualified small business stock held for more than 3 years. Stock held within a 25-percent controlled group is not eligible for this exclusion. Amendments to various sections of the tax code are made to reflect these changes. The heading for section 1202 of the tax code is amended by removing "partial" and the item in the table of sections is updated accordingly. The tax code is amended to exclude gain from certain small business stock and repeal the minimum tax preference and the 28 percent capital gains rate on qualified small business stock. The tax code is amended to redesignate certain paragraphs and sections, including changing references from section 1(h)(11) to section 1(h)(10) in various parts of the Code. The tax code is amended to increase the aggregate asset limitation for qualified small businesses from $50,000,000 to $100,000,000, with an inflation adjustment provision for taxable years after 2009. The tax code is amended to increase the aggregate asset limitation for qualified small businesses to $100,000,000 with an inflation adjustment provision for taxable years after 2009. The amendments apply to stock issued after December 31, 2008. The amendments made by subsections (a), (b), and (c) apply to sales or exchanges of stock issued on or before December 31, 2008, by a taxpayer other than a corporation.
